html: 11.27.23  8:48 am   I like it that an answer somehow achieves it's own flavour and meaning when it comes from a certain person, their doesn't have to be anything special about that person, but it's something unique about that person that makes what they say seem so powerfully something (it's especially from people you seem to have a great understanding in) - it's something I noticed when you give really short answers to questions, or reallyseemingly simple ones, it's not only the text - there's also the fact thatyou're saying it ("it's funny because I get what you mean by that" I sometimes think). And I also realised just now that that could apply to everything, and there's so many inaccessible layers to people's art or what they say that I'll never get, but it somehow is still able to touch me so deeply -or the opposite of that case where people want to let you in to help you understand them better - and layers are neither opaque nor transparent, there's a spectrum of openness and closed ness and it's pretty darn crazy I have to say
original_html: 11.27.23  8:48 am   I like it that an answer somehow achieves it's own flavour and meaning when it comes from a certain person, their doesn't have to be anything special about that person, but it's something unique about that person that makes what they say seem so powerfully something (it's especially from people you seem to have a great understanding in) - it's something I noticed when you give really short answers to questions, or reallyseemingly simple ones, it's not only the text - there's also the fact thatyou're saying it ("it's funny because I get what you mean by that" I sometimes think). And I also realised just now that that could apply to everything, and there's so many inaccessible layers to people's art or what they say that I'll never get, but it somehow is still able to touch me so deeply -or the opposite of that case where people want to let you in to help you understand them better - and layers are neither opaque nor transparent, there's a spectrum of openness and closed ness and it's pretty darn crazy I have to say
